column1: The sum of n terms of a sequence is $2\cdot n^{2} + 4$ then its nth term is
The sum of n terms of the series whose nth term is $n(n - 1)(n + 1)$
The sum of 80 terms of the series whose nth term is $n\cdot (n^{2} - 1)$
What is the sum to n terms of the series $1 + 3^{3} + 5^{3} +\cdots$
What is the sum to n terms of the series $1 + 4^{2} + 7^{2} + 10^{2} + \cdots$
What is the sum to 2n terms of the series $1 + 2 + 3^{2} + 4 + 5^{2} + 6 + 7^{2} + \cdots$
What is the sum to n terms of the series $1 - 2^{2} + 3^{2} - 4^{2} + 5^{2} +\cdots$
column2: the answer is $\frac{1}{2}\cdot n(n + 1)$ when n is odd or $\frac{1}{2}\cdot n(n + 1)$ when n is even
